articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Again Bier of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Again Bier of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and sagacious leader of the party, state and army of the DPRK, together with servicepersons and people from all walks of life, Monday visited again the bier of fatherly leader Kim Jong Il and expressed profound condolences.
					
					 The Kumsusan Memorial Palace was wrapped in a solemn atmosphere and the national flag was hoisted at half-mast. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un together with senior officials of the party, state and armed forces organs paid silent tribute, praying for the immortality of Kim Jong Il in reflection of the unanimous wishes of all the servicepersons and people of the country and the world progressives, before going round the bier in bitterest grief.
					
					 There were tears in the eyes of Kim Jong Un seeing servicepersons and people wailing and calling the fatherly leader in chocking voices.
					
					 Mourning the demise of Kim Jong Il in humblest reverence, they renewed pledge of faith before his bier in reflection of the unshakable faith of all servicepersons and people.
					
					 Among the mourners were senior officials of the party, state and armed forces organs Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Kyong Hui, Kim Yong Chun, Jon Pyong Ho, Kim Kuk Thae, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Yang Hyong Sop, Ri Yong Mu, O Kuk Ryol, Kang Sok Ju, Pyon Yong Rip, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Yong Il, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Rak Hui, Thae Jong Su, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, Ju Kyu Chang, U Tong Chuk and Kim Chang Sop. 
					
					 The glorious history of Songun revolution of Kim Jong Il will be given steady continuity at all times as Kim Jong Un, great successor to the Juche revolutionary cause and sagacious leader of our party, state, army and people, is at the helm of the Korean revolution.

articles.title: KCNA Report on Inspection by Kim Jong Il with Dedication
articles.content:
KCNA Report on Inspection by Kim Jong Il with Dedication

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The Korean Central News Agency released a report Monday on the general offensive for Juche (100)2011, led by Kim Jong Il who made forced march till the last moments of his life.
					
					 The report said: 
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il gave energetic field guidance this year, too, to glorify with shining victory the advance for great surge for greeting the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung to be commemorated as a great auspicious event of the nation.
					
					 He guided the combined exercises of the three services of the Korean People's Army and inspected posts on defence line, augmenting the might of Workers' Party of Korea's idea of attaching importance to arms and military affairs.
					
					 He visited the vast territories of China and Russia day and night in May and August, making great contributions to the country's prosperity and human cause of independence.
					
					 His long journey of external activities had been led to field guidance to Huichon area.
					
					 The change of the Huichon Ryonha General Machinery Plant that has turned into a world-level machine tools factory under his leadership is as significant as an industrial revolution in the new century. This manifested the potentials of the national economy of the DPRK that has entered the era of knowledge-based economy.
					
					 He visited the modern glass production base as the first stop of his field guidance this year and then visited the workers of Songgang, convincing them that Juche is the path to be unswervingly followed by the DPRK's economy.
					
					 Thanks to his field guidance to a big chemical base in Namhung in May this year in the wake of that in June last year, the fertilizer production system relying on naphtha came to an end.
					
					 Units that had been visited by him during his tireless field guidance included the Biological Engineering Branch of the State Academy of Sciences and industrial establishments in North Phyongan Province such as and the machine manufacturing base in Rakwon which produces modern machines at its will as well as sophisticated tools factory equipped with highest-level CNC-based stream-lined production system.
					
					 Kim Jong Il visited workers of the Ryongsong Machine Complex and the February 8 Vinalon Complex four times this year and the gasification process construction site in Hungnam several times to create the new Chollima speed, speed of Korea.
					
					 His visit to the Tanchon Port construction site offered a historic occasion that let the people of the DPRK display their mental spirit of devotedly carrying out whatever they determine.
					
					 He continued his undying footsteps to industrial establishments in Tanchon area and a model farm and orchards in Ryongjon and Toksong on the eastern coast.
					
					 He went round the commodity exhibition of Pyongyang Department Store No. 1 despite hot weather in July, giving important teachings to further improve the country's light industry and promote commercial services.
					
					 He made sure that modern Meat and Fish Shop in Pothongmun Street was built in six months and gave on-site guidance to it. He instructed officials to build more vegetable production bases such as the Pyongyang Vegetable Scientific Research Institute and supply people with fresh vegetables all the year round.
					
					 Thanks to his guidance the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm has turned into a land of bliss in the Songun era and modern combined fruit processing base, stock-breeding base and net production base sprang up.
					
					 Kim Jong Il also left his footprints of great guidance to stock-breeding and fish-breeding farms and orchards across the country including the Tudan Duck Farm, the Kujang Fish Breeding Farm and the Kosan Fruit Farm.
					
					 He also provided field guidance to Mansudae area construction to turn Pyongyang into a magnificent and world-level city replete with the revolutionary outlook on the leader in the run-up to the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 During the last period of his life he went round the Hana Music Information Center and the Kwangbok Area Supermarket where he took measures to supply fresh fish to Pyongyang citizens, very pleased that the supermarket would be conducive to improving the people's livelihood.
					
					 Kim Jong Il displayed superhuman strength combating mental and physical strain and illness to bring the people's desire into a reality. His heart stopped beating on a running train to our sorrow. So lamentable is his sudden demise as he passed away with the day, when prosperous socialist Korea so much desired by him is to emerge, just at hand.
					
					 In the greatest national loss, the army and people of the DPRK are keenly realizing what an outstanding leader they had been led by along the path of victory and glory and what sacrificing field guidance Kim Jong Il had given to lay an eternal boon for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: S. Korean Mourners' Groups Here
articles.content:
S. Korean Mourners' Groups Here

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- South Korean mourners' groups led by Ri Hui Ho, widow of former President Kim Dae Jung, and Hyon Jong Un, chairwoman of the Hyundai Group, Monday arrived here via Kaesong on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: S. Korean Mourners' Groups Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
S. Korean Mourners' Groups Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Ri Hui Ho, widow of former south Korean President Kim Dae Jung, and her party and Hyon Jong Un, chairwoman of Hyundai Group, and her party Monday paid respects to the bier of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Seen beside the bier was a wreath sent by Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Kim Jong Un was standing vigil by the side of the bier together with members of the National Funeral Committee.
					
					 Amid the playing of solemn music, wreaths were laid in the name of Ri Hui Ho, managing director of the Kim Dae Jung Peace Center, and Hyon Jong Un, chairwoman of Hyundai Group.
					
					 They paid silent tribute to the bier of Kim Jong Il and viewed it.
					
					 They expressed deep condolences and sympathy to Kim Jong Un.
					
					  He expressed thanks for them.
					
					  They made entries in mourners' book.
					
					  Ri Hui Ho wrote that Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il passed away but she hopes the spirit of the June 15 South-North Joint Declaration would be carried forward to achieve national reunification as early as possible.
					
					 Hyon Jong Un wrote that the chairman of the National Defence Commission who made efforts for national reconciliation and cooperation would be always remembered by them.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from President of Buryatia Republic
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from President of Buryatia Republic

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The National Funeral Committee for Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, on Dec. 22 received a message of condolences from Nagovitsin, president of the Republic of Buryatia, the Russian Federation.
					
					 The message said:
					
					 The Republic of Buryatia of the Russian Federation received with deepest sorrow the sad news that Comrade Kim Jong Il, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, passed away.
					
					 He was an outstanding statesman, staunch and dedicated man and revolutionary with high prestige.
					
					 He met with President of the Russian Federation Dmitri Medvedev in the capital city of Buryatia and, in this course, I was greatly honored to see him.
					
					 I, on behalf of the government and all people of the Republic of Buryatia, express profound condolences and heartfelt sympathy to the people of the DPRK.
					
					 The Republic of Buryatia is also saddened and feels sorrow over irrevocable loss.
					
					 Please accept my sincere condolences.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from Nigerian President
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from Nigerian President

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of condolences from Goodluck Ebele Jonathan, president of Nigeria, on Dec. 22. 
					
					 The message said:
					
					 Permit me to commiserate with you, firstly as the son of an illustrious flag bearer. You also have the onerous responsibility of being his Great successor. 
					
					 In this respect, I wish to convey, on behalf of myself, the Government and people of Nigeria, heartfelt condolences to you, the government and people of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea. Our dear friend departed at a time when he had invested heavily in the cause of peace as evident in his efforts to resume the six-party talks. 
					
					 Respected Comrade Kim Jong Il also spent the last days of his life in the search for prosperity and economic wellbeing of his people. The regular visits to China and the recent understanding he reached with his Russian counterpart are living testimonies of his untiring efforts. 
					
					 Your illustrious predecessor has succeeded in building a special relationship with me and Nigeria, for which I am indeed very grateful. May I take this opportunity to assure you of the continued friendship, support and assistance of the Federal Government of Nigeria in the effort to build on the achievements of our dear friend, respected General Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 May his gentle soul rest in peace.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from Ecuadorian Vice-President
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from Ecuadorian Vice-President

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a condolatory message from Lenin Moreno Garces, vice-president of Ecuador, on Wednesday.
					
					 In the message Lenin Moreno Garces expressed his deepest condolences to Kim Jong Un over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He, on behalf of the Ecuadorian people, extended deep sympathy to the fraternal Korean people.
					
					 Kim Jong Il will live forever, the vice-president said, wishing Kim Jong Un success in his work in the new year.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from Syrian Minister of Defense
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from Syrian Minister of Defense

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of condolences from Daud Bin Abdullah Razha,               minister of Defense and deputy commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces of Syria, on December 22.
					
					 He said in the message that though leader Kim Jong Il passed away, his ideas and feats would shine forever.
					
					 He, on his own and on behalf of the officers and men of the Syrian Arab army, expressed heartfelt condolences to Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 He said that Kim Jong Un's assumption of heavy responsibility as the supreme leader of the Korean people provides a firm guarantee for the steady development, progress and prosperity of the Korean people and army.
					
					 He was convinced that Kim Jong Un will overcome sorrow and display strength and courage and build the friendly DPRK into a more powerful country.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from Party Leaders of Various Countries
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from Party Leaders of Various Countries

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received condolatory messages from party leaders of different countries between Dec. 19 and 22 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included a joint message from President Alberto Moreno Lohas, General Secretary Rolando Brena Pantoja of the C.C., Communist Party of Peru (Red Motherland).
					
					  Among them were also messages from Sergio Rubens De Araujo Torres, national president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil, Nurdin Purnomo, chairman of the National Leading Council of the Diversity Unity Party of Indonesia, Prakash Karat, general secretary of the C.C., Communist Party of India (Marxist), Ali Houdou, president of the Socialist Party of Benin, Tan Sri Koh Tsu Kon, president of the Malaysian People's Movement, A. Usupbayev, chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgys El" Republican Political Party and chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Kyrgyzstan and Cha Soi Lek, president of the Malaysian Chinese Association.
					
					 The messages expressed condolences to Kim Jong Un, the WPK and the Korean people on the demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Un also received a condolence message from the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Ecuador on Dec. 19.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from Bangladeshi Party Leader
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from Bangladeshi Party Leader

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, Thursday received a condolatory message from Mujahidul Islam Selim, general secretary of the C.C., Bangladesh Communist Party.
					
					 The message said:
					
					 We, on behalf of the C.C., Bangladesh Communist Party, express our deep condolences on the demise of Comrade Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the WPK, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Comrade Kim Jong Il was the legendary outstanding leader of the anti-imperialist movement.
					
					 He devoted his whole life to the struggle for freedom, peace and progress against imperialism and capitalist exploitation.
					
					 The Bangladesh Communist Party is recalling in humble reverence the activities of Comrade Kim Jong Il who waged the uncompromising and resolute struggle against U.S. imperialism and hegemony.
					
					 He wisely and successfully led the WPK and the building of Korean-style socialism despite the imperialists' blockades and plots.
					
					 I pay my revolutionary salute to him who will always be with us in the struggle for peace, freedom and socialism.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from S. Korean Organization
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from S. Korean Organization

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The All-People Council for National Reconciliation and Cooperation in south Korea on Dec. 20 sent a condolatory message to the National Reunification Council of the DPRK over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 We express our deep condolences on the demise of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission, and extend our sympathy to all the compatriots in grief in the north, the message said.
					
					 We will closely cooperate and solidarize with you on the road for reconciliation and cooperation between the south and the north and their common prosperity in the future, too, according to the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, it added.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from Headquarters of S. Korean Organization
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from Headquarters of S. Korean Organization

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The Panel of Agricultural Workers of the North Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration and the Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers in the DPRK received a message of condolences from the Peasants Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, the Panel of Youth and Students from the Headquarters of Youth and Students, the Women's Panel from the Headquarters of Women and the Academic Panel from the Academic Headquarters on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il on Dec. 21 and 23.  
					
					 The messages expressed condolences on the demise of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission who provided the landmark for national reunification and its guideline, the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration. 
					
					 Meanwhile, a joint message of condolences came on Dec. 23 from 13 regional headquarters of the South Side Committee (Seoul, Inchon, Pusan, Ulsan, Taejon, Kyonggi Province, North Jolla Province, Kwangju-South Jolla Province, Taegu-North Kyongsang Province, South Kyongsang Province, North and South Chungchong Provinces and Jeju).

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from S. Korean Women's Organizations
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from S. Korean Women's Organizations

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of Women's Organizations and the Women's Society for Achieving Peace Thursday sent a message to the Democratic Women's Union of Korea to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The message expressed deep condolences over the untimely demise of Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il and extended sympathy to the women in the north in grief.
					
					 The exploits Kim Jong Il performed by dedicating himself to peace and reunification will remain long, it said.
					
					 It hoped that cooperation between women of the south and the north would be intensified.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from S. Korean Religious Bodies
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from S. Korean Religious Bodies

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Messages of condolences came from ten religious organizations in south Korea on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included the Peace Council of Religionists, the General Affairs Department of the Central Committee of Chondoism, Buddhist Orders Council, Headquarters for Promoting the National Community of Buddhist Jogye Order, Buddhist Association for the Peaceful Reunification of the Country, Round Buddhism, Council of Christian Church, Christian Presbyterian Church, Catholic Priests' Council for Justice and the Committee for Reconciliation of the Council of the Association of Catholic Bishops.
					
					 In the messages they expressed sincere condolences over the demise of Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il.  
					
					 The messages extended deep sympathy to the compatriots in the north and its religionists overwhelmed with bitter sorrow at the loss of their supreme leader.
					
					 They hoped that the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration signed by Kim Jong Il at the south-north summits would be implemented.
					
					 The messages called on all the religionists in the south and the north to overcome the present sorrow and advance along the avenue of national reconciliation and peaceful reunification.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from Newspaper of S. Korea
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from Newspaper of S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The Jaju Minbo of south Korea Monday sent a condolatory message over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 All members of the Jaju Minbo courteously express condolences on the demise of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission, and extend deep sympathy carrying compatriotic feelings to the compatriots in the north in bitter grief, the message said.
					
					 He devotedly worked to achieve the national reunification through implementation of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, its action program, it noted, saying that his demise is bitter sorrow and a great loss to the Korean nation.
					
					 It hoped that the compatriots in the north would overcome the sorrow as soon as possible and display strength to rise up.

articles.title: Wreath from Ugandan President
articles.content:
Wreath from Ugandan President

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, president of Uganda, sent a wreath in deep mourning over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The wreath was laid before the bier of Kim Jong Il on display at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace, on Dec. 26.

articles.title: Wreath from Equatorial Guinean President
articles.content:
Wreath from Equatorial Guinean President

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Obiang Nguema Mbasogo, president of Equatorial Guinea who is president of the African Union, presented a wreath to express his deep condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The wreath was laid before the bier of Kim Jong Il at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Monday.

articles.title: Wreath from Malian President
articles.content:
Wreath from Malian President

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Amadou Toumani Toure, president of Mali, expressed profound condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					Authorized by the Malian president, the minister of Defense and Veterans visited a mourning center in Bamako and paid silent tribute to Kim Jong Il on December 23.
					
					 He said:
					
					 On behalf of the president of Mali I express profound condolences to all Korean people.
					
					 The Malian people are now sharing sorrow with the Korean people.
					
					 The sorrow of the Korean people is just the sorrow of the Malian people.
					
					 I hope the Korean people will overcome the present sorrow and register successes in the building of a thriving nation under the leadership of respected HE Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Wreath from ANC
articles.content:
Wreath from ANC

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- A wreath came from the African National Congress of South Africa expressing deep condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The wreath was laid before the bier of Kim Jong Il at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on December 26.

articles.title: Wreaths from Foreign Personages
articles.content:
Wreaths from Foreign Personages

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Johnny Hon, chairman of the International Kim Il Sung Foundation, Keith Bennett, its secretary general, and Matteo Carbonelli, secretary general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche idea, sent wreaths to express deep condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.        
					
					 The wreaths were placed before the bier of Kim Jong Il at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Dec. 26.

articles.title: Wreath from President of World Peace Federation
articles.content:
Wreath from President of World Peace Federation

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Moon Sun Myung, president of the World Peace Federation, sent a wreath to express deep condolences on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The wreath was laid before the bier of Kim Jong Il at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Monday.

articles.title: Wreath from Chongryon
articles.content:
Wreath from Chongryon

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) sent a wreath to express deep condolences on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, on Monday laid the wreath before the bier of Kim Jong Il who has gone on display at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace.
					
					 Also placed before the bier were wreaths from Chairman So Man Sul and Chief Vice-Chairman Ho Jong Man of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee.

articles.title: Wreaths from Chinese Organizations
articles.content:
Wreaths from Chinese Organizations

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The Dandong Liya Trading Co., Ltd. and the Dandong Chengda Commerce Trading Co., Ltd. of China sent wreaths in deep mourning over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The wreaths were laid before the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il at Kim Il Sung Square on Dec. 26.

articles.title: Lao President Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Lao President Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Choummaly Sayasone, general secretary of the C.C., Lao People's Revolutionary Party, president of the Lao People's Democratic Republic and chairman of the Central Committee of Defence and Security of Laos, on Monday paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Vientiane on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Accompanying him were Vice Prime Minister and concurrently Foreign Minister Thongloun Sisoulith, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., LPRP and chairman of the Party Committee for External Affairs, the chairman of the Organization Committee of the LPRP who is secretary of its Central Committee, Cheuang Sombounkhan, secretary of the C.C., LPRP and chairman of its Propaganda and Education Ideological Committee, Phongsavath Boupha, minister and secretary general of the Presidency, and other officials concerned. 
					
					 The president and his party laid a wreath before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and expressed deep condolences. 
					
					 He wrote in the mourners' book:
					
					 The passing away of Comrade Kim Jong Il is not only a great loss to the party, government and people of the fraternal DPRK, who lost their great leader, but also sorrow to the Lao party, government and people, who lost their close friend with the common ideal.

articles.title: President of Xinhua Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
President of Xinhua Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- President Li Congjun and officials of the Xinhua News Agency on Monday paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Beijing on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They expressed their deep condolences on his demise.

articles.title: ITAR-TASS Delegation Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
ITAR-TASS Delegation Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the ITAR-TASS of Russia led by its Deputy Director-General Golayev visited the DPRK embassy in Moscow on Monday to express condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The delegation paid silent tribute to Kim Jong Il before his portrait.
					
					 The deputy director-general expressed his most profound condolences to the Korean people.
					
					 He said: Comrade Kim Jong Il performed great exploits for the world peace and security and the development of the friendly relations between the two countries.
					
					 His answers to questions put by our agency twice created lively response not only in Russia but in the world and made a great contribution to the peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and in the rest of the world.
					
					 The director-general of the ITAR-TASS and all its journalists and editors are confident that the Korean people will overcome the present sorrow, true to the leadership of supreme leader Comrade Kim Jong Un, and surely build a thriving nation desired by Comrade Kim Jong Il in his lifetime.

articles.title: First Deputy Speaker of Russian State Duma Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
First Deputy Speaker of Russian State Duma Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The first deputy speaker of the State Duma of Russia on Dec. 23 paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Moscow on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He left a bouquet before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and expressed profound condolences.
					
					 He said: 
					
					 The sudden demise of Kim Jong Il is a great loss not only to the Korean people but also to the friendly Russian people. 
					
					 Our Russian people and all deputies to the State Duma, sharing the present sadness and sorrow with the Korean people, are sure that they will creditably carry forward to completion the cause of Comrade Kim Jong Il, closely rallied around respected Comrade Kim Jong Un, the supreme leader of the DPRK.

articles.title: UN Official Visits DPRK Mission
articles.content:
UN Official Visits DPRK Mission

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Yuri Fedotov, director-general of the UN Office at Vienna, Thursday paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK mission in Vienna on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He paid a silent tribute to the memory of Kim Jong Il before his portrait.
					
					 He wrote in the condolence book that he, on behalf of the Office, expresses heartfelt condolences on the demise of Kim Jong Il and extends sympathy to the people of the DPRK.
					
					 He hoped that the Korean people would overcome the present sorrow and difficulties and contribute to the world peace and stability.

articles.title: Representative of IMO Secretary General Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Representative of IMO Secretary General Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The representative of the secretary general of the International Maritime Organization on Dec. 21 paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in London over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He paid silent tribute to Kim Jong Il before his portrait.
					
					 He wrote in the mourners' book: 
					
					 I, on behalf of the secretary general of the International Maritime Organization and our staff members, express the deepest condolences to all the Korean people and the government of the DPRK over the demise of the great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.

articles.title: Germans Visit DPRK Ebassy
articles.content:
Germans Visit DPRK Ebassy

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- German personages of different circles Friday paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy in Berlin on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. They included the chairman of the C.C., Communist Party of Germany, the secretary general of the Germany Cardiology Centre and the vice-chairman of the Federal Republic of Germany-DPRK Association.
					
					 They laid bunches of flowers before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and expressed deep condolences.
					
					 The chairman of the C.C., CPG said he could hardly repress bitter pain at the demise of Kim Jong Il, adding that his presence inspired the progressive people with confidence and worth of life.
					
					 He expressed belief that the Korean people would accomplish the cause of Kim Jong Il to the last by remaining loyal to General Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Kim Jong Il was really a great man, the secretary general of the Centre said, hoping that the Korean people would build a prosperous and powerful country by implementing his behests without fail.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the Association said that he would strive to contribute to the building of an economic power in the DPRK.
					
					  Meanwhile, ambassadors and charges d'affaires a.i. of Laos, Vietnam, Thailand, Iran, Mongolia, Egypt and Bulgaria to this country visited the DPRK embassy to mourn his demise.

articles.title: Nepali Personages Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Nepali Personages Visit DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Personages of political parties and organizations in Nepal paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy in Katmandu between Dec. 21 and 23 over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They were ex-Prime Minister Madav Kumar Nepal, leader of the C.C., Communist Party (United Marxist-Leninist) and honorary chairman of the International Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung, Pashupati Shumsher J. B. Rana, chairman of the C.C., National Democratic Party, Bam Dev Gautam, vice-chairman of the C.C., Communist Party (United Marxist-Leninist), K. P. Sharma Oli, chairman of the Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Committee who is director of the International Department of the C.C., Communist Party (United Marxist-Leninist), and Chairman Manju Ratna Sakya and members of the Journalist Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Politics.
					
					 The visitors placed floral baskets and bouquets before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and expressed their deep condolences.

articles.title: Bangladeshi Personages Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Bangladeshi Personages Visit DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Personages of political and social circles in Bangladesh visited the DPRK embassy in Dhaka on Dec. 22 and 23 to mourn over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included Dilip Barua, general secretary of the C.C., Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist) who is minister of Industries, Khaleq Zaman Bhuiyan, general secretary of the C.C., Socialist Party, the deputy inspector-general of the Police Agency and the editor-in-chief of the newspaper Natun Bangla.
					
					 They laid wreaths before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and expressed deep condolences.
					
					 Meanwhile, ambassadors of Russia, Myanmar, Indonesia and Bhutan to this country paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy.

articles.title: Ethiopian Personages Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Ethiopian Personages Visit DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Personages of different circles of Ethiopia and diplomatic envoys of different countries paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy on Dec. 22 over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Those personages included the director－general of the Department for Asia of the Ethiopian Foreign Ministry, the president and the vice-president of University of Addis Ababa and the director of the Addis Ababa Gabriel Hospital.
					
					 The visitors laid wreaths and bouquets before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and observed a moment's silence.
					
					 The director-general said that the demise of Kim Jong Il is sorrow not only to the Korean people but to the Ethiopian people.
					
					 He expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop under the deep care of Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: ANC Officials Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
ANC Officials Visit DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The African National Congress of South Africa expressed deep condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A vice-director of its International Department and his party visited the DPRK embassy in South Africa on Dec. 23 to lay a wreath before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and paid silent tribute to him on behalf of the African National Congress of South Africa.

articles.title: Indonesians Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Indonesians Visit DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Personages and political parties, organizations and institutions of Indonesia mourned the demise of leader Kim Jong Il on Dec. 20 and 21.
					
					 Upon authorization of President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono, Foreign Minister Raden Mohammad Marty Muliana Natalegawa paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Djakarta.
					
					 The foreign minister paid a moment's silence before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and made an entry in the condolence book.
					
					 Also visiting the embassy to express condolences were the deputy secretary general of the Central Directive Council of the Democratic Party of Struggle, the chairman of the Advisory Council of the National Democratic Party, the director general for Protocol and Consular Relations of the Foreign Ministry, the vice-chairman of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry, the chief of the editorial department of the Surara Karya and the manager of the Rabitra Bahtera Pratama Co. and others.
					
					 Wreaths were sent to the DPRK embassy by the speaker of the People's Consultative Assembly, the general chairman of the Central Directive Council of the Democratic Party of Struggle, the chairman of the Committee for Founding the Soekarno Foundation for Education, the Pioneer Party of Indonesia, the Indonesia-Korea Association for Friendship and Cultural Exchange, the New Indonesian Artistic Foundation and other personages, parties, organizations and institutions.
					
					 Meanwhile ambassadors and charges d'affaires a.i. of Russia, Cuba, Vietnam, Laos, Cambodia, Syria, India, Yemen, United Arab Emirates, Zimbabwe, Brunei, Uzbekistan, Ukraine, Australia, Brazil and Venezuela to this country and the Lao ambassador and the Thai permanent representative to ASEAN paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy.

articles.title: Bolivian Ambassador to Brazil Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Bolivian Ambassador to Brazil Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Bolivian President Evo Morales Aima expressed deep condolences on the passing of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Upon authorization of the president, the Bolivian ambassador to Brazil paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Brasilia on Dec. 23 and paid a silent tribute to the memory of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 He asked the DPRK ambassador to convey an oral condolence message of the Bolivian president to Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 The message said:
					
					 I would like to express condolences to Your Excellency Kim Jong Un, the leader of the Korean people, on the passing away of HE Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea. 
					
					 It's my firm belief that the Korean people will victoriously advance the socialist cause under your leadership.

articles.title: Ecuadorians Visit DPRK Nourning Station
articles.content:
Ecuadorians Visit DPRK Nourning Station

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Political and social personages of Ecuador visited the mourning station of the DPRK Koryo medical aid group in Quito on Dec. 21 to express condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Among them were Julio Bueno Fernando, special envoy of the Ecuadorian vice-president, Milton Burbano, chairman of the Ecuadorian National Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung, Nelson Ortiz, director general of the Television Station "Tele Andina 23", and Rene Regato, member of the C.C., Communist Party of Ecuador. 
					
					 The visitors laid wreaths before the portrait of Kim Jong Il at the mourning station and observed a moment's silence. 
					
					 Julio Bueno Fernando noted that the vice-president expressed his deep condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il and sent him as a special envoy to pay respects to the leader. 
					
					 Nelson Ortiz said that his family, who received love and benevolence of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il much more than anyone else, would as ever hold those great men in high esteem as eternal father. 
					
					 Milton Burbano said Kim Jong Il is a great statesman recognized by the world. 
					
					 His Songun idea has served as the treasured sword of sure victory protecting the DPRK in every way and as the beacon of hope for the world progressives, he added.
					
					 Though he passed away, his revolutionary Songun idea will show the road ahead of mankind forever as there is Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, he stressed.

articles.title: Condolence Delegations of Chongryon Arrive
articles.content:
Condolence Delegations of Chongryon Arrive

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Delegations of mourners of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) paid respects to the portrait of smiling leader Kim Jong Il at Kim Il Sung Square here on Monday.
					
					 They are delegation of officials of Chongryon led by Hwang Myong, chairman of its Tokyo Metropolitan Headquarters, delegation of young officials of Chongryon led by Kim Cha Dol, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Youth League in Japan, delegation of officials of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan led by Kwon Kyong Ae, vice-chairwoman of its Central Standing Committee, delegation of Chongryon educational officials led by Ha Thae Hong, director of the Hagu Bookshop, and delegation of literary artists and athletes of Chongryon led by Pak Jong Sang, permanent advisor of the Union of Korean Writers and Artists in Japan.
					
					 The delegations laid bouquets and flowers before the portrait and paid a silent tribute in deep mourning over the demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They arrived here on the same day.

articles.title: Chinese Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Chinese Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Words fail to describe the grief over the sudden demise of Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people and close friend of the Chinese people, said  Zhang Jinquan, son of Zhang Weihua, a Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, when interviewed by KCNA Monday.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 When I heard the sad news that Comrade Kim Jong Il passed away, over TV and radio in China, I was all at sea how to tide over the days to come.
					
					 I could hardly believe his demise as I watched the TV showing him conducting energetic activities by visiting China twice this year.
					
					 All my family members wept bitterly.
					
					 We rushed here, finding no way to keep back the grief over his demise.
					
					 It is an obligation for our family to mourn his demise.
					
					 General Kim Jong Il was the tender-hearted father of our family.
					
					 Whenever I received the loving care shown by him, I wished to call him father as I felt as if I were seeing President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The whole life of respected Kim Jong Il was the noblest one as he glorified the tradition of the Sino-DPRK friendship and took deep care of our family with brotherly affection.
					
					 His demise is not only a great loss to the Korean nation but bitterest grief of our family.
					
					 I am confident that the revolutionary history of General Kim Jong Il will last forever thanks to respected Comrade Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Russian Diplomats Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Russian Diplomats Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Russian diplomatic envoys to Shenyang of China, Mongolia, Uganda, Libya and Peru called at or sent messages to DPRK missions in those countries between Dec. 20 and 22 to mourn the passing of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The consul general of Russia to Shenyang paid a consolatory visit to the DPRK mission and paid a silent tribute in humble reverence to the memory of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 He wrote in the condolence book: Upon hearing the sad news that Comrade Kim Jong Il, the leader of the DPRK and close friend of Russia, passed away suddenly I, with bitterest sorrow, express my deepest condolences and heartfelt sympathy to the Korean people.

articles.title: Chinese Delegations Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Chinese Delegations Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Delegations of China expressed condolences to the bier of leader Kim Jong Il on Monday.
					
					 Among them were delegations of the National Economic Development General Company in Heilongjiang Province, the Tianjin Digital Trade Co. Ltd., etc.
					
					 Laid before the bier were wreaths in the name of the delegations.
					
					 The guests paid silent tribute to the bier of Kim Jong Il in humble reverence before viewing it.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomats Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Staff members of embassies of Cuba, Malaysia, Indonesia and the Czech Republic and India and those of missions here of the World Health Organization, the World Food Programme and the United Nations Children's Fund paid respects to the bier of leader Kim Jong Il on Dec. 26.
					
					 Amid the playing of solemn music wreaths were laid in the name of the Malaysian embassy and missions of the WHO, the WFP and the UNICEF. 
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to the bier of Kim Jong Il who made an undying contribution to the human cause of independence and went round it.
					
					 They made entries in the mourners' book.

articles.title: Diplomats Visit DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Diplomats Visit DPRK Missions

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Personages of foreign countries and international organizations paid condolatory visits to the DPRK missions in Italy and France and at the UN between Dec. 21 and 23 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included the assistant director-general of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations who is acting director-general of the FAO, its chief of protocol, the vice-president and the secretary general of the International Fund for Agricultural Development, the deputy director-general for information of the UNESCO, the vice-director of the Regional Bureau for Asia and Pacific and the section chief for Northeast Asia and Mekong region of the UNDP, the vice-chairman of the Korean Association in the U.S., the Lao ambassador to France and the Cuban and Lebanese representatives at UNESCO.
					
					 They expressed deepest condolences over the demise of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Families of Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, families of those related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle and their parties and overseas Koreans paid respects to the bier of leader Kim Jong Il on Monday. 
					
					 They included the family of Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr Zhang Weihua and families of Shang Yue, Chen Lei and Hu Zhenyi who are Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, families of Li Zade and So Sun Ok, China-resident Korean anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters, and families of Ri Kwan Rin and Kim Sun Ok who are China-resident Koreans related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle.
					
					 Among them were also a delegation of mourners from the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan led by Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of its Central Standing Committee, a visiting group of mourners from the General Association of Koreans in China led by Chairperson Choe Un Bok, a visiting group of mourners from the Federation of Korean National Economic Workers in China led by Chairperson An Mi Ja, a visiting group of mourners from the Council of Chairmen of the Association of Korean National Businessmen in China led by Chairman Phyo Song Ryong, Pak Chol Su, president of Korea Taepung International Investment Group Ltd., Jong Il Sim residing in Russia, Vice-Chairperson of the United Confederation of Koreans in Russia An Hyang Jin, a visiting group of mourners from the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. led by Chairman Yun Kil Sang, Widow of Yun I San Ri Su Ja and a visiting group of mourners from the World Peace Federation led by President Moon Hyung Jin. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, was standing guard of honor near the bier of Kim Jong Il, together with members of the National Funeral Committee. 
					
					 The mourners laid wreaths before the bier and paid a silent tribute in humblest reverence to it before viewing it. 
					
					 They expressed their deep condolences and sympathy to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Kim Jong Un heartily thanked them for this. 
					
					 The mourners made entries in the condolence book.

articles.title: Russian Embassy Officials Hold Mourning Ritual
articles.content:
Russian Embassy Officials Hold Mourning Ritual

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Ambassador Valery Sukhinin and staff members of the Russian embassy here held a ritual at the Jongbaek Church on Monday in deep mourning over leader Kim Jong Il's demise.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Jang Jae On, chairman of the Religious Believers Council of Korea, and officials concerned.
					
					 The participants paid respects to Kim Jong Il who made immortal contributions to the development of the DPRK-Russia friendly relations and the human cause of independence.
					
					 The Russian ambassador said at the ritual that Kim Jong Il showed deep care for the development of bilateral friendly ties, adding that the Russian people express their heartfelt sympathy to the Korean people.

articles.title: Officials in Field of Agriculture Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Officials in Field of Agriculture Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Grief over the untimely demise of leader Kim Jong Il is growing deeper with the passage of time. 
					
					 Officials and workers in the field of agriculture across the country are visiting mourning stations where portraits of Kim Jong Il are displayed and expressing deepest condolences on his demise.
					
					 An atmosphere of mourning is running high at the units honored with the field guidance by Kim Jong Il including cooperative farms in Unhung in Thaechon County, Oguk in Anak County and Yangdong in Unpha County. 
					
					 Co-op farms in Ryongsan in Ryokpho District of Pyongyang, Porim in Onchon County, Ryongchon in Hwangju County and Posok in Unjon County were crowded with an endless stream of mourners. 
					
					 Lamentation could be heard from mourning stations at various units including Mangyongdae and Chilgol Vegetable Farms in Mangyongdae District.
					
					 The mourners are renewing their firm will to bring about a steady boost in agricultural production, looking up to the image of Kim Jong Il who dedicated himself to the work to let the Korean people live as well as others.

articles.title: Mourning Centers Crowded with Wailing People
articles.content:
Mourning Centers Crowded with Wailing People

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) --The whole country is wrapped in an atmosphere of mourning the demise of leader Kim Jong Il in bitter grief.
					
					 Officials and other working people and school youth and children in Ryanggang Province are visiting the portraits of smiling Kim Jong Il, mosaics depicting peerlessly great persons and mourning stations at industrial establishments to express condolences in bitterest sorrow.
					
					 Officials of camps for visitors to Mt. Paektu, lecturers of revolutionary history and people in Samjiyon County bitterly wept in front of the birthplace of Kim Jong Il in the Paektusan secret camp, looking up to Jong Il Peak where fireworks were displayed in every February.
					
					 Officials and other working people of different circles in Kangwon Province visiting Haean Square where the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il is displayed are reluctant to leave the place, overcome with indescribable grief over his demise.
					
					 People in Nampho City are bitterly lamenting, looking up to the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il displayed in front of the Nampho Theater as he demised so suddenly and early to their great regret.

articles.title: Employees of Power Stations Strive for Increased Production
articles.content:
Employees of Power Stations Strive for Increased Production

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- With the bitterest grief at the sudden demise of leader Kim Jong Il, all the Korean people are uniting close around Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and the great successor to the revolutionary cause of Juche, while striving for increased production in various economic sectors.
					
					 Over the past five days the electric power output has increased throughout the country, an average of 500,000 kilowatts more than the previous days.
					
					 Ho Ryong Ho, a vice department director of the Ministry of Electric Power Industry, told KCNA:
					
					  "Employees of power stations throughout the country are making redoubled efforts to translate into reality the desire of Kim Jong Il for the building of a thriving nation." 
					
					 The output of the thermal-power stations has increased more than 20 percent.
					
					 The Pukchang and Pyongyang thermal-power complexes and East Pyongyang Thermal Power Station are keeping generating equipment in full-capacity operation.
					
					 The Sunchon and Chongjin thermal power stations are operating one more generator respectively to boost the power output. 
					
					Suphung, Wiwon, Taedonggang, Sodusu and other hydro-power stations have also raised the power output, a daily average of 110,000 kilowatts more than the plan from the first days of December. 
					
					 Coal industrial and transport sectors have supplied coal, over 60 percent higher than before, to power stations.

articles.title: Signal Innovations in Mansudae Area Construction
articles.content:
Signal Innovations in Mansudae Area Construction

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Builders and soldiers in the Mansudae area construction site are speeding up the construction by overcoming sorrow over the loss of leader Kim Jong Il and displaying strength and courage. Construction is going on day and night.
					
					 Leveling of an area covering at least  50,000 square meters has been completed in just three days though it  would have taken one month at ordinary tempo. As a result, thousands of meter long roads have been improved and 40,000 cubic meters of earth have been removed.
					
					 Construction methods suited to winter conditions have been introduced. Water-proofing operations have been carried out for hundreds of flats and at least 1,200 door frames have been fixed. Work results have doubled inside flats and in the construction of public buildings, public service network and facilities as compared with those before Dec. 19. 
					
					 Soldier builders are accelerating water-proofing, conduit laying and final stage work by displaying the spirit of fierce offensive. 
					
					 Members of a shock brigade under the youth league central committee construction group are fulfilling their daily quotas while builders of the Ryongsan construction group have successfully finished inside plastering of ground floor service facilities.
					
					 Work is going full steam ahead at construction sites of public buildings and service networks.
					
					 More signal successes are being reported from the construction sites there thanks to the high-pitched drive of officials and builders to loyally uphold the leadership of Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Setting up of Seoul Incense-burning Altar Proposed
articles.content:
Setting up of Seoul Incense-burning Altar Proposed

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The Association of Victims of "National Security Law" in south Korea proposed setting up an incense-burning altar in Seoul to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 In a statement the organization said that it is an obligation for the south Koreans to express deep condolences on the demise of Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It will set an incense-burning altar for memorial service for all people in front of the "Taehanmun" in Seoul on Monday now that the "government" disallowed the visit of non-government level group of mourners to Pyongyang, it noted, adding that it would set the incense-burning altar up without fail though police block it.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Slams Authorities Blocking Condolatory Visit
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Slams Authorities Blocking Condolatory Visit

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The All-People Council for National Reconciliation and Cooperation of south Korea on Dec. 25 accused the authorities of their unethical action taken to block a condolatory visit by a non-governmental organizations, according to south Korean KBS.
					
					 It recalled that though the organization is striving hard to dispatch a mourners' group of non-governmental level, the "government" has not yet allowed the visit, claiming that "it is hard to change the already fixed principle" and the like. 
					
					 It has, in fact, become impossible to implement the plan to pay a condolatory visit during the mourning period, the organization said.
					
					 It warned the authorities that the issue of mourners' group should not cause serious consequences to the society.

articles.title: Visit to DPRK by Group of Mourners Proposed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Visit to DPRK by Group of Mourners Proposed in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The United Progressive Party of south Korea Monday proposed to form an emergency group of mourners which will visit the DPRK to pay respects to leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 We urgently propose to form a nongovernmental group of mourners with political parties and religious, civic and public organizations of south Korea which will visit the north over the demise of Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il, the Party said in its statement, adding:
					
					 We urge again the authorities to cooperate in dispatching the group of mourners.

articles.title: Syrian Ministry Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Syrian Ministry Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Expatriates of Syria issued a statement on Dec. 21 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The statement, expressing the deepest condolences to the close Korean people, manifested conviction that Kim Jong Il's cause would be steadily carried forward by Comrade Kim Jong Un as desired by the world progressive people. 
					
					 It said that Kim Jong Il conducted energetic external activities for the victory of the socialist cause and peace and stability in the world and the development of friendship among the peoples of the world, making undying contributions to the accomplishment of the human cause of independence. 
					
					 The Syrian people feel grateful to Kim Jong Il for extending support to their just cause, it noted.

articles.title: Mexican Parties Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Mexican Parties Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico issued a statement on Dec. 22 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The statement said: Kim Jong Il was born as a son of guerillas and a son of the nation in the secret camp in Mt. Paektu. His life was the one of a great and noble man and peerless patriot.
					
					 Standing at the helm of the Korean revolution is respected Comrade Kim Jong Un, great successor to the revolutionary cause of Juche and the outstanding leader of the party, army and people of the DPRK.
					
					 Kim Jong Un is the spiritual mainstay and a beacon of hope for the army and the people of the DPRK.
					
					 It is the greatest fortune for the Korean people to have another peerlessly great man to whom they can entrust their destiny and future and follow. It is only the Korean nation who is blessed with the illustrious leaders generation after generation.
					
					 The statement expressed conviction that the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people would more dynamically advance to win new victories under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Meanwhile, Cuautemoc Amezcua Dromundo, chairman of the Central Committee of the Socialist Popular Party of Mexico, issued a statement on Dec. 22.
					
					 In the statement he stressed the world would clearly witness how the Korean people would rise up again and the Korean revolution would win victory after victory without any vacillation and frustration under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Organizations of Foreign Countries Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Organizations of Foreign Countries Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il

					Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Different organizations of the world sent letters to the Pyongyang Mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front on Dec. 19 and 20, expressing profound condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Switzerland-Korea Committee, the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, the North American Group for Study of the Juche, Songun Idea in the U.S. and the North American Committee against Zionism and Imperialism.
					
					 In the letters they highly praised Kim Jong Il as a great revolutionary, the ever-victorious iron-willed brilliant commander, a peerless thinker and theoretician and an outstanding leader of the human cause of independence who dedicated himself to the country and people all his life.
					
					 HE Kim Jong Il will always live in the hearts of not only the Korean people but mankind, the letters noted.
					
					 Songun Korea and the human cause of independence are sure to triumph under the leadership of respected Comrade Kim Jong Un. they stressed.

articles.title: UNFAO Hoists Flag at Half-mast
articles.content:
UNFAO Hoists Flag at Half-mast

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations hoisted the flag at half-mast on its building on Dec. 21 over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 At a staff members meeting of the organization held on the same day the participants observed a minute silence in memory of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Secretariat of the organization proposed to the Technical Working Committee chairmen to pay silent tribute to Kim Jong Il at its meetings.

articles.title: Memorial Service for Kim Jong Il Held in Nigeria
articles.content:
Memorial Service for Kim Jong Il Held in Nigeria

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- A memorial service for leader Kim Jong Il took place in Abuja, Nigeria on December 22.
					
					 Displayed at its venue were photos showing his immortal feats.
					
					 Aba Sadik Abubakr, chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy, said in his speech that Kim Jong Il was the spiritual mainstay for the adherents to the Juche idea.
					
					 Ahmed Blaza Lawan, chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Songun Politics, said that not only the Korean people but also all other peoples in Northeast Asia enjoying peace should extend heartfelt thanks to Kim Jong Il, an iron-willed brilliant commander.
					
					 Igwanagu Nicholas, chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of Kimjongilism, said: The core of Kim Jong Il's traits is love for the people. As he loved the people very much, he enforced the benevolent politics unprecedented in the world and had been on the train of journey to mix with the people until the last moments of his life.
					
					 M. M. Alhassan, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, stressed that the undying feats performed by Kim Jong Il for global independence and the complete victory of the Juche idea would remain forever with his august name.
					
					 Prior to the memorial service, the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea declared the days from December 22 to 29 as a mourning period.

articles.title: Memorial Services for Kim Jong Il Held in Nepal
articles.content:
Memorial Services for Kim Jong Il Held in Nepal

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Memorial services were held at the C.C., Nepal Worker-Peasant Party and the National Press Club of Nepal on December 23 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The participants left bunches of flowers before his portrait and paid silent tribute to him.
					
					 The speakers including the chairman of the C.C., Nepal Worker-Peasant Party expressed deep condolences on the demise of Kim Jong Il and hoped that the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people would overcome bitter sorrow and display strength and courage.
					
					 They noted that though Kim Jong Il passed away, the feats he performed for global independence and anti-imperialist struggle would shine long.
					
					 The chairman of the Study and Research Forum of Songun Politics of the National Press Club of Nepal praised the immortal feats Kim Jong Il performed for the Korean revolution and the world revolution. 
					
					 He expressed belief that the Korean people would accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK.
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the memorial service at the National Press Club of Nepal.

articles.title: Memorial Services for Kim Jong Il Held in Mongolia and Mozambique
articles.content:
Memorial Services for Kim Jong Il Held in Mongolia and Mozambique

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Memorial services were held by the Mt. Paektu Association for Independent Development of Mongolia, the Mongolia-DPRK Friendship Joint Venture Hospital and a hospital in Mozambique on Dec. 21 and 23 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Present there were personages of various circles and masses of those countries.
					
					 The participants observed silent tribute and expressed deep condolences over the demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Introduced there was a short history of his revolutionary activities.
					
					 The executive chairman of the above-said association noted that Kim Jong Il conducted energetic external activities, remarkably raising the international prestige and dignity of the DPRK and making an immortal contribution to accomplishing the human cause of independence.
					
					 The director of the hospital in Mozambique expressed his deep condolences over the demise of Kim Jong Il, saying that he was a great leader who made an undying contribution to the accomplishment of the human cause of independence.

articles.title: Danish Organization Carries Consolatory Article
articles.content:
Danish Organization Carries Consolatory Article

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association posted a condolatory article with a portrait of leader Kim Jong Il on its Internet homepage on Dec. 20 on his demise.
					
					 The article said as follows:
					
					 Comrade Kim Jong Il passed away from a sudden illness on Dec. 17, 2011 on his way to field guidance.
					
					 He had long worked at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 He developed in depth the Juche idea by authoring a lot of works and indicated ways of reunifying the country.
					
					 He provided the north-south summit meetings in Pyongyang in 2000 and 2007 which led to the adoption of the north-south declarations.
					
					 The international prestige of the DPRK has risen remarkably thanks to his leadership.
					
					 The Association expresses profound condolences upon the news that the Korean people suffered great loss.
					
					 The same day, an organ of the Communist Party of Denmark published an article of the same contents carrying a portrait of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Socialist Party of Romania Declares Mourning Period
articles.content:
Socialist Party of Romania Declares Mourning Period

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- A memorial service was held at the building of the Socialist Party of Romania on December 22 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A decision was made public at the service to set a mourning period from Dec. 22 to 24.
					
					 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Supreme Council of the party, said in his memorial address that the life of Kim Jong Il was the one of a great man and hero, adding:
					
					 HE Kim Jong Il developed in depth the Juche idea, the Songun idea founded by President Kim Il Sung through his energetic ideological and theoretical activities, glorifying it as guiding idea in the era of independence and leading the Korean revolution along the road of victory.
					
					 HE Kim Jong Il will always live in the hearts of not only the Korean people but the world progressives for his undying feats for the Korean revolution and global independence.
					
					 We are firmly convinced that the Songun cause, the socialist cause of HE Kim Jong Il will be successfully carried forward without an inch of deviation and the struggle of the Korean people to build a thriving nation and reunify the country is sure to triumph under respected supreme leader Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Ethiopian Organization Declares Mourning Period
articles.content:
Ethiopian Organization Declares Mourning Period

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea declared the mourning period till Dec. 29 over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The group in a statement on Dec. 22 said that it would pay silent tribute to the memory of Kim Jong Il at regular meetings of its headquarters and branch groups and hold events praising his exploits including a reading session during the period.

articles.title: Foreign Papers Carry over Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Papers Carry over Demise of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of different countries carried articles on Dec. 21 and 22 over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Russia's paper Zavtra in an article titled "In memory of Comrade Kim Jong Il" said:
					
					 The leadership of Comrade Kim Jong Il enabled the DPRK to frustrate the imperialists' moves and stand high in the center of the arena of world politics.
					
					 His enormous feat is that he put forward Comrade Kim Jong Un as the successor to the cause of President Kim Il Sung and himself.
					
					 He will always be remembered by humankind as he dedicated himself to the interests of the Korean people, human progress and global peace.
					
					 Proretaren, a Swedish newspaper, referred to the fact that the Korean people are mourning the demise of Kim Jong Il in bitterest sorrow, adding this eloquently proves that he was the leader always supported by the people.
					
					 A Pakistani newspaper in an article noted that the army and people of the DPRK are following Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, as a beacon of hope. His idea and intention are just the same as those of His Excellency Kim Jong Il, it added.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Suk Praised by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Suk Praised by British Organization

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted special write-ups on its Internet homepage on December 16 on the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 The homepage posted articles illustrated with a photo of the great persons of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The homepage in an article titled "Peerlessly brilliant commander of Songun" noted Kim Jong Il trained the KPA as a strong driving force of revolution and brought about a radical turn in all fields including politics, economy and culture, taking it as a model.
					
					 Only victory and glory are in store for the heroic KPA and the Korean people advancing towards a bright morrow of a thriving nation, always holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem, it stressed.
					
					 The homepage in an article titled "Peerlessly woman commander" noted Kim Jong Suk's life was one of the outstanding revolutionary and the great patriot as she devoted her all to protecting the revolutionary ideas and safety of President Kim Il Sung and bringing about the bright future of the country and nation.
					
					 The greatest feat performed by her is that she gave birth to Kim Jong Il and brought him up to be the successor to the revolutionary cause of Juche and the great leader who would shoulder responsibility for the future of Korea.
					
					  It noted colorful events are taking place in different parts of the world to praise the woman commander of Mt. Paektu, adding her immortal exploits would shine forever.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Career Remembered by 400 Countries
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Career Remembered by 400 Countries

					 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- This year progressive people of a total of more than 400 countries remembered the brilliant revolutionary career of President Kim Il Sung in humblest reverence and highly praised him. 
					
					 Ancon County of Lima Province, Peru, registered Kim Il Sung as its honorary citizen and presented citizenship and a key to the county to him. 
					
					 Political parties, organizations, regional bodies and figures of different strata of many countries made public statements, highly praising his immortal revolutionary exploits. 
					
					 Governments, political parties and organizations of various countries and regional bodies presented floral baskets to the DPRK embassies while personages of different social standings visited DPRK missions and left floral baskets and bouquets before his portraits and paid tribute to him on the New Year, the Day of the Sun, the 17th anniversary of his demise, the 63rd anniversary of the DPRK and the 66th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					
					 Seminars on the Juche idea were held on different themes. 
					
					 National seminars, joint seminars and East European regional discussion on his exploits took place in Nepal, Peru, Uganda and Russia.
					
					 The participants in the Bangladeshi national seminar on the Juche idea initiated a world conference on the Juche idea in Pyongyang in April, 2012, the centenary of  his birth, and appealed to its followers the world over to attend it. 
					
					 Preparatory committees were inaugurated in many countries to commemorate the centenary of his birth with splendor.  
					
					 Political parties, organizations, institutions of various countries and international and regional organizations held a total of 420 colorful political and cultural celebrations to significantly commemorate April 15, the Day of the Sun. 
					
					 Media of different countries gave wide publicity to the immortal exploits and greatness of Kim Il Sung, the greatest man in the 20th century.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un expresa condolencias de nuevo ante feretro de Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un expresa condolencias de nuevo ante feretro de Kim Jong Il

					Pyongyang, 26 de diciembre (ACNC) --           Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Dirigente clarividente del PTC, el Estado y el ejercito, volvio a expresar el dia 26 las mas profundas condolencias ante el cuerpo del Dirigente Kim Jong Il junto con los oficiales y soldados del EPC y habitantes de distintos sectores.
					
					Transcurria un clima solemne en el Palacio Memorial Kumsusan donde esta izada la bandera a media asta.
					
					Junto con los cuadros directivos acompanantes de las instituciones del partido, el Estado y las fuerzas armadas, Kim Jong Un guardo con inmenso dolor un momento de silencio ante el cuerpo de Kim Jong Il deseando su eternidad en representacion de la devocion unanime de todos los militares y civiles coreanos y de la humanidad progresista del mundo y dio una vuelta al feretro.
					
					Se le humedecieron los ojos cuando miraba a los oficiales y soldados y los habitantes que lloraban sin parar llamando desconsolados al Dirigente          Kim Jong Il.
					
					Rindiendo el maximo tributo a la memoria del Dirigente, los participantes en la ocasion prestaron el juramento de fe, en reflejo de la ferrea voluntad de todos los oficiales y soldados del EPC y el pueblo.
					
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion los cuadros de los organos del partido, el Estado y las fuerzas armadas Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Kyong Hui, Kim Yong Chun, Jon Pyong Ho, Kim Kuk Thae, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Yang Hyong Sop, Ri Yong Mu, O Kuk Ryol, Kang Sok Ju, Pyon Yong Rip, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Yong Il, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Rak Hui, Thae Jong Su, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, Ju Kyu Chang, U Tong Chuk y Kim Chang Sop. 
					
					La gloriosa historia revolucionaria del Songun del Dirigente Kim Jong Il continuara siempre porque esta al frente de la Revolucion Coreana el camarada Kim Jong Un, gran sucesor de la causa revolucionaria del Juche y Dirigente clarividente del partido, el Estado, el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea.

articles.title: Publicada informacion de ACNC sobre abnegada guia de Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Publicada informacion de ACNC sobre abnegada guia de Kim Jong Il

					Pyongyang, 26 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Se hizo publica este lunes la informacion de la Agencia Central de Noticias de Corea sobre el hecho de que el Dirigente Kim Jong Il dirigio al frente la ofensiva general de este ano emprendiendo sin parar hasta el ultimo momento de su grandiosa vida la marcha forzada de orientacion en el terreno.
